choices.answer: a contact force, it acts in an opposite direction to motion
a contact force, it acts with an objects motion
non contact force, acts in the opposite direction to motion
non contact force, acts in the same direction to motion
friction between a moving object and a surface
friction between a stationary object and a surface
friction between moving parts
friction between the air and an object
resistancecreated by two objects sliding against each other
friction between a stationary object and a surface
friction between two stationary objects
friction between the air and an object

questions.question: Static friction is caused by intermolecular forces

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Sliding friction is caused by the physical differences in the textures of two objects/surfaces

choices.answer: True
False
picking up an object
grip on your shoes
rubbing hands together
All of the above
increase mass, remove lubricant, make surface rougher
decrease mass, add lubricant, make surface smoother
only an increase in mass can reduce friction
only a decrease in mass can reduce friction
increase mass, remove lubricant, make surface rougher
decrease mass, remove lubricant, make surface smoother
only an increase in mass can increase friction
only a decrease in mass can increase friction

questions.question: Mass is the amount of matter in an object, it is the same where ever you go.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Weight in Newtons depends on the gravitational force acting upon you.

choices.answer: True
